info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:50PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Defiance and central Paulding Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 749 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Paulding, or 12 miles southeast of Hicksville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Defiance around 825 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Haviland, Worstville, Ney, Brunersburg, Latty, Mark Center, Briceton, Tipton, Cecil and Broughton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for west central Ohio.
